caption.title: Ecuador, situated on the northwestern coast of South America (inset), has historically high prevalence of mosquito-borne diseases.
caption.p: The Ecuadorian Ministerio de Salud Pública (MSP) conducted household entomological surveys of Aedes aegypti throughout the country from 2000–2012. Spatially unique larval index (LI) occurrence records (n = 478) collected in the survey were aggregated to cities and towns and used to model the ecological distribution of Ae. aegypti in Ecuador. This figure was produced in ArcMap 10.4 (ESRI, Redlands, CA) using shapefiles from the GADM database of Global Administrative Areas, ver. 2.8 (gadm.org), elevation data freely available from NASA’s Shuttle Radar Topography Mission ( jpl.nasa.gov/srtm), and georeferenced mosquito surveillance data provided by the MSP and edited by CAL.
